comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of September 24, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0D11F93A5C1373... mentions a Harry Balfe and his "showy chestnut gelding Maximum." This piece is about the first day of the annual Mineola Horse Show. Could be this Harry Balfe (1860-1944), born in Newburgh, NY: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=79663861 The photo is not a perfect match but a possiblity. He bred horses.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: More evidence that this could be the right Balfe. beta.worldcat.org/archivegrid/record.php?id=772215754 has a finding aid for the papers of the Harry Balfe born in Newburgh NY in 1860 and they include two awards won by Maximum. If so, his wife is the former May Adams.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A finding aid for Isham family papers mms.newberry.org/html/Isham.html indicates that there were several generations of Ishams with Ralph as first name. NYT of September 17, 1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20F13FE395D16738... indicates that Mr. Ralph Heyward Isham and his young wife, the former Miss Marion Gaynor, were getting a divorce. She was a horsewoman and so it makes sense or her to be keeping company with Harry Balfe and his wife at what seems likely to be a horse show. A Bain photo taken before Marion Gaynor's first marriage is Could be the same woman, although not a certainty. By 1936, according to NYT of Dec 4, 1936 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00A17F83C5A1B7B... [subscription needed] she was about to marry for the fourth time.
